draw_text.description:
[Function]draw_text(x,y,string) 
Draws the string at position (x,y), using the drawing color and alpha. A # symbol or carriage return chr(13) or linefeed chr(10) are interpreted as newline characters. In this way you can draw multi-line texts. (Use \# to get the # symbol itself.)

draw_text_ext.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext(x,y,string) 
Similar to the previous routine but you can specify two more things. First of all, sep indicates the separation distance between the lines of text in a multiline text. Use -1 to get the default distance. Use w to indicate the width of the text in pixels. Lines that are longer than this width are split- up at spaces or - signs. Use -1 to not split up lines.

draw_arrow.description:
[Function]draw_arrow(x1,y1,x2,y2,size) 
Draws an arrow from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2). size indicates the size of the arrow in pixels.

draw_button.description:
[Function]draw_button(x1,y1,x2,y2,up) 
Draws a button, up indicates whether up (1) or down (0).

draw_path.description:
[Function]draw_path(path,x,y,absolute) 
With this function you can draw the indicated path in the room with its start at position (x,y). If absolute is true the path is drawn at the position where it was defined and the values of x and y are ignored.

draw_healthbar.description:
[Function]draw_healthbar(x1,y1,x2,y2,amount,backcol,mincol,maxcol,direction,showback,showborder) 
With this function you can draw a healthbar (or any other bar that indicates some value, like e.g. the damage). The arguments x1, y1, x2 and y2 indicate the total area for the bar. amount indicates the percentage of the bar that must be filled (must lie between 0 and 100). backcol is the color of the background for the bar. mincol and maxcol indicate the color when the amount is 0 and 100 respectively. For an amount in between the color is interpolated. So you can easily make a bar that goes e.g. from green to red. The direction is the direction in which the bar is drawn. 0 indicates that the bar is anchored at the left, 1 at the right, 2 at the top and 3 at the bottom. Finally showback indicates whether a background box must be shown and showborder indicated whether the box and bar should have a black border line.

draw_clear.description:
[Function]draw_clear(col) 
Clears the entire room in the given color (no alpha blending).

draw_clear_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_clear_alpha(col,alpha) 
Clears the entire room in the given color and alpha value (in particular useful for surfaces).

draw_point.description:
[Function]draw_point(x,y) 
Draws a point at (x,y) in the current color.

draw_line_width.description:
[Function]draw_line_width(x1,y1,x2,y2,w) 
Draws a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) with width w.

draw_rectangle.description:
[Function]draw_rectanglet(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws a rectangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_roundrect.description:
[Function]draw_roundrect(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws a rounded rectangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_triangle.description:
[Function]draw_triangle(x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3,outline) 
Draws a triangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_circle.description:
[Function]draw_circle(x,y,r,outline) 
Draws a circle at (x,y) with radius r. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_ellipse.description:
[Function]draw_ellipse(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws an ellipse. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_set_circle_precision.description:
[Function]draw_set_circle_precision(precision) 
Sets the precision with which circles are drawn, that is, the number of segments they consist of. The precision must lie between 4 and 64 and must be dividable by 4. This is also used for drawing ellipses and rounded rectangles.

draw_set_color.description:
[Function]draw_set_color(col) 
Sets the drawing color to be used from now on for drawing primitives.

draw_set_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_set_alpha(alpha) 
Sets the alpha transparency value to be used from now on for drawing primitives. Should lie in the range 0-1. 0 is fully transparent, 1 is fully opaque.

draw_get_color.description:
[Function]draw_get_color() 
Returns the drawing color used for drawing primitives.

draw_get_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_get_alpha() 
Returns the alpha value used for drawing primitives.

draw_getpixel.description:
[Function]draw_getpixel(x,y) 
Returns the color of the pixel corresponding to position (x,y) in the room. This is not very fast, so use with care.

draw_sprite.description:
[Function]draw_sprite(sprite,subimg,x,y) 
Draws subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with its origin at position (x,y). (Without color blending and no alpha transparency.)

draw_sprite_stretched.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_stretched(sprite,subimg,x,y,w,h) 
Draws the sprite stretched so that it fills the region with top-left corner (x,y) and width w and height h.

draw_sprite_tiled.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_tiled(sprite,subimg,x,y) 
Draws the sprite tiled so that it fills the entire room. (x,y) is the place where one of the sprites is drawn.

draw_sprite_part.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_part(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y) 
Draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y).

draw_background.description:
[Function]draw_background(back,x,y) 
Draws the background at position (x,y). (Without color blending and no alpha transparency.)

draw_background_stretched.description:
[Function]draw_background_stretched(back,x,y,w,h) 
Draws the background stretched to the indicated region.

draw_background_tiled.description:
[Function]draw_background_tiled(back,x,y) 
Draws the background tiled so that it fills the entire room.

draw_background_part.description:
[Function]draw_background_part(x,y,r,outline) 
Draws the indicated part of the background with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y).

draw_sprite_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_ext(sprite,subimg,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite scaled with factors xscale and yscale and rotated counterclockwise over rot degrees. color is the blending color (use c_white for no blending) and alpha indicates the transparency factor with which the images is merged with its background. A value of 0 makes the sprite completely transparent. A value of 1 makes it completely solid. This function can create great effect (for example partially transparent explosions).

draw_sprite_stretched_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_stretched_ext(sprite,subimg,x,y,w,h,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite stretched so that it fills the region with top-left corner (x,y) and width w and height h. color is the blending color and alpha indicates the transparency setting.

draw_sprite_tiled_ext.description:
[Function]draw_circle(sprite,subimg,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite tiled so that it fills the entire room but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_sprite_part_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_part_ext(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y) but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_sprite_general.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_general(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
The most general drawing function. It draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y) but now with scale factors, a rotation angle, a color for each of the four vertices (top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left), and an alpha transparency value. Note that rotation takes place around the top-left corner of the part.

draw_set_font.description:
[Function]draw_set_font(font) 
Sets the font that will be used when drawing text. Use -1 to set the default font (Arial 12).

draw_set_halign.description:
[Function]draw_set_halign(halign) 
Sets the horizontal alignment used when drawing text. Choose one of the following constants as values: 
fa_left 
fa_center 
fa_right

draw_set_valign.description:
[Function]draw_set_valign(valign) 
Sets the vertical alignment used when drawing text. Choose one of the following constants as values: 
fa_top 
fa_middle 
fa_bottom

draw_text_transformed.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed(x,y,string,xscale,yscale,angle) 
Draws the string at position (x,y) in the same way as above, but scale it horizontally and vertically with the indicated factors and rotate it counter-clockwise over angle degrees.

draw_text_ext_transformed.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext_transformed(x,y,string,sep,w,xscale,yscale,angle) 
Combines the function draw_text_ext and draw_text_transformed. It makes it possible to draw a multi-line text rotated and scaled.

draw_text_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_color(x,y,string,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Draws the string at position (x,y) like above. The four colors specify the colors of the top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left corner of the text. alpha is the alpha transparency to be used (0-1).

draw_text_ext_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext_color(x,y,string,sep,w,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_ext() but with colored vertices.

draw_text_transformed_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed_color(x,y,string,xscale,yscale,angle,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_transformed() but with colored vertices.

draw_text_ext_transformed_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed_color(x,y,string,sep,w,xscale,yscale,angle,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_ext_transformed() but with colored vertices.

draw_point_color.description:
[Function]draw_point_color(x,y,col1) 
Draws a point at (x,y) in the given color.

draw_line_color.description:
[Function]draw_line_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,col1,col2) 
Draws a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2), interpolating the color between col1 and col2.

draw_line_width_color.description:
[Function]draw_line_width_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,w,col1,col2) 
Draws a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) with width w interpolating the color between col1 and col2.

draw_rectangle_color.description:
[Function]draw_rectangle_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,col1,col2,col3,col4,outline) 
Draws a rectangle. The four colors indicated the colors at the top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left vertex. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_roundrect_color.description:
[Function]draw_roundrect_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,col1,col2,outline) 
Draws a rounded rectangle. col1 is the color in the middle and col2 the color at the boundary. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_triangle_color.description:
[Function]draw_triangle_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3,col1,col2,col3,outline) 
Draws a triangle. The three colors are the colors of the three vertices which is interpolated over the triangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_circle_color.description:
[Function]draw_circle_color(x,y,r,col1,col2,outline) 
Draws a circle at (x,y) with radius r. col1 is the color in the middle and col2 the color at the boundary. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_ellipse_color.description:
[Function]draw_ellipse_color(x1,y1,x2,y2,col1,col2,outline) 
Draws an ellipse. col1 is the color in the middle and col2 the color at the boundary. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_primitive_begin.description:
[Function]draw_primitive_begin(kind) 
Start a primitive of the indicated kind.

draw_vertex.description:
[Function]draw_vertex(x,y) 
Add vertex (x,y) to the primitive, using the color and alpha value set before.

draw_vertex_color.description:
[Function]draw_vertex_color(x,y,col,alpha) 
Add vertex (x,y) to the primitive, with its own color and alpha value. This allows you to create primitives with smoothly changing color and alpha values.

draw_primitive_end.description:
[Function]draw_primitive_end() 
End the description of the primitive. This function actually draws it.

draw_primitive_begin_texture.description:
[Function]draw_primitive_begin_texture(kind,texid) 
Start a primitive of the indicated kind with the given texture.

draw_vertex_texture.description:
[Function]draw_vertex_texture(x,y,xtex,ytex) 
Add vertex (x,y) to the primitive with position (xtex,ytex) in the texture, blending with the color and alpha value set before. xtex and ytex should normally lie between 0 and 1 but also larger values can be used, leading to a repetition of the texture (see below).

draw_vertex_texture_color.description:
[Function]draw_vertex_texture_color(x,y,xtex,ytex,col,alpha) 
Add vertex (x,y) to the primitive with position (xtex,ytex) in the texture, blending with its own color and alpha value.

draw_set_blend_mode.description:
[Function]draw_set_blend_mode(mode) 
Indicates what blend mode to use. The following values are possible: bm_normal, bm_add, bm_subtract, and bm_max. Don't forget to reset the mode to normal after use because otherwise also other sprites and even the backgrounds are drawn with the new blend mode.

draw_set_blend_mode_ext.description:
[Function]draw_set_blend_mode_ext(font) 
Indicates what blend mode to use for both the source and destination color. The new color is some factor times the source and another factor times the destination. These factors are set with this function. To understand this, the source and destination both have a red, green, blue, and alpha component. So the source is (Rs, Gs, Bs, As) and the destination is (Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad). All are considered to lie between 0 and 1. The blend factors you can choose for source and destination are:  
bm_zero: Blend factor is  (0, 0, 0, 0). 
bm_one: Blend factor is  (1, 1, 1, 1). 
bm_src_color: Blend factor is (Rs, Gs, Bs, As). 
bm_inv_src_color: Blend factor is (1–Rs, 1–Gs, 1–Bs, 1–As). 
bm_src_alpha: Blend factor is (As, As, As, As). 
bm_inv_src_alpha: Blend factor is (1–As, 1–As, 1–As, 1–As). 
bm_dest_alpha: Blend factor is (Ad, Ad, Ad, Ad). 
bm_inv_dest_alpha: Blend factor is (1–Ad, 1–Ad, 1–Ad, 1–Ad). 
bm_dest_color: Blend factor is (Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad). 
bm_inv_dest_color: Blend factor is (1–Rd, 1–Gd, 1–Bd, 1–Ad). 
bm_src_alpha_sat: Blend factor is (f, f, f, 1); f = min(As, 1–Ad). 
For example, the normal blending mode sets the source blending to bm_src_alpha and the destination blending to bm_inv_src_alpha. Don't forget to reset the mode to normal after use because otherwise also other sprites and even the backgrounds are drawn with the new blend mode.

draw_surface.description:
[Function]draw_surface(id,x,y) 
Draws the surface at position (x,y). (Without color blending and no alpha transparency.)

draw_surface_stretched.description:
[Function]draw_surface_stretched(id,x,y,w,h) 
Draws the surface stretched to the indicated region.

draw_surface_tiled.description:
[Function]draw_surface_tiled(id,x,y) 
Draws the surface tiled so that it fills the entire room.

draw_surface_part.description:
[Function]draw_surface_part(id,left,top,width,height,x,y) 
Draws the indicated part of the surface with its origin at position (x,y).

draw_surface_ext.description:
[Function]draw_surface_ext(id,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,color,alpha) 
Draws the surface scaled and rotated with blending color (use c_white for no blending) and transparency alpha (0-1).

draw_surface_stretched_ext.description:
[Function]draw_surface_stretched_ext(id,x,y,w,h,color,alpha) 
Draws the surface stretched to the indicated region. color is the blending color and alpha indicates the transparency setting.

draw_surface_tiled_ext.description:
[Function]draw_surface_tiled_ext(id,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the surface tiled so that it fills the entire room but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_surface_part_ext.description:
[Function]draw_surface_part_ext(id,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the surface tiled so that it fills the entire room but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_surface_general.description:
[Function]draw_surface_general(id,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
The most general drawing function. It draws the indicated part of the surface with its origin at position (x,y) but now with scale factors, a rotation angle, a color for each of the four vertices (top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left), and an alpha transparency value.

make_color_rgb.description:
[Function]make_color_rgb(red,green,blue) 
Returns a color with the indicated red, green, and blue components, where red, green and blue must be values between 0 and 255.

make_color_hsv.description:
[Function]make_color_hsv(hue,saturation,value) 
Returns a color with the indicated hue, saturation and value components (each between 0 and 255).

color_get_red.description:
[Function]color_get_red(col) 
Returns the red component of the color.

color_get_green.description:
[Function]color_get_green(col) 
Returns the green component of the color.

color_get_blue.description:
[Function]color_get_blue(col) 
Returns the blue component of the color.

color_get_hue.description:
[Function]color_get_hue(col) 
Returns the hue component of the color.

color_get_saturation.description:
[Function]color_get_saturation(col) 
Returns the saturation component of the color.

color_get_value.description:
[Function]color_get_value(col) 
Returns the value component of the color.

merge_color.description:
[Function]merge_color(col1,col2,amount) 
Returns a merged color of col1 and col2. The merging is determined by amount. A value of 0 corresponds to col1, a value of 1 to col2, and values in between to merged values.

screen_save.description:
[Function]screen_save(fname) 
Saves a png image of the screen in the given filename. Useful for making screenshots.

screen_save_part.description:
[Function]screen_save_part(fname,x,y,w,h) 
Saves part of the screen in the given png filename.

string_width.description:
[Function]string_width(string) 
Width of the string in the current font as it would be drawn using the draw_text() function. Can be used for precisely positioning graphics.

string_height.description:
[Function]string_height(string) 
Height of the string in the current font as it would be drawn using the draw_text() function.

string_width_ext.description:
[Function]string_width_ext(string,sep,w) 
Width of the string in the current font as it would be drawn using the draw_text_ext() function. Can be used for precisely positioning graphics.

string_height_ext.description:
[Function]string_height_ext(string,sep,w) 
Height of the string in the current font as it would be drawn using the draw_text_ext() function.

texture_preload.description:
[Function]texture_preload(texid) 
Puts the texture immediately into video memory.

texture_set_priority.description:
[Function]texture_set_priority(texid,prio) 
When there is too little video memory some will be removed temporarily to make room for others that are needed. The ones with lowest priority are removed first. Default, all have priority 0 but you can change the priority here. (Use positive values!)

texture_get_width.description:
[Function]texture_get_width(texid) 
Returns the width of the texture with the given id. The width lies in the range 0-1.

texture_get_height.description:
[Function]texture_get_height(texid) 
Returns the height of the texture with the given id. The height lies in the range 0-1.

texture_set_interpolation.description:
[Function]texture_set_interpolation(linear) 
Indicates whether to use linear interpolation (true) or pick the nearest pixel (false). Linear interpolation gives smoother textures but can also be a bit blurry and sometimes costs extra time. This setting also influence the drawing of sprites and background. Default is false. (This can also be changed in the global game settings.)

texture_set_blending.description:
[Function]texture_set_blending(blend) 
Indicates whether to use blending with colors and alpha values. Switching this off might be faster on old hardware. This setting also influence the drawing of sprites and background. Default is true.

texture_set_repeat.description:
[Function]texture_set_repeat(repeat) 
Indicates whether to use repeat the texture. This works as follows. As indicated above texture coordinates lie in the range 0-1. If you specify a value larger than 1, default the rest is not drawn. By setting repeat to true the texture is repeated. Note that sprites and backgrounds are always drawn without repeating. So once you draw a sprite of background this value is reset to false. Default is false.

surface_create.description:
[Function]surface_create(w,h) 
Creates a surface of the indicated width and height. Returns the id of the surface, which must be used in all further calls. Note that the surface will not be cleared. This is the responsibility of the user. (Set it as a target and call the appropriate clear function.)

surface_free.description:
[Function]surface_free(id) 
Frees the memory used by the surface.

surface_exists.description:
[Function]surface_exists(id) 
Returns whether the surface with the indicated id exists.

surface_get_width.description:
[Function]surface_get_width(id) 
Returns the width of the surface.

surface_get_height.description:
[Function]surface_get_height(id) 
Returns the height of the surface.

surface_get_texture.description:
[Function]surface_get_texture(id) 
Returns the texture corresponding to the surface. This can be used to draw textured objects with the image of the surface.

surface_set_target.description:
[Function]surface_set_target(id) 
Sets the indicated surface as the drawing target. All subsequent drawing happens on this surface. It resets the projection to simply cover the surface.

surface_reset_target.description:
[Function]surface_reset_target() 
Resets the drawing target to the normal screen.

surface_getpixel.description:
[Function]surface_getpixel(id,x,y) 
Returns the color of the pixel corresponding to position (x,y) in the surface. This is not very fast, so use with care.

surface_save.description:
[Function]surface_save(id,fname) 
Saves a png image of the surface in the given filename. Useful for making screenshots.

surface_save_part.description:
[Function]screen_save_part(id,fname,x,y,w,h) 
Saves part of the surface in the given png filename.

surface_copy.description:
[Function]surface_copy(destination,x,y,source) 
Copies the source surface at position (x,y) in the destination surface. (Without any form of blending.)

surface_copy_part.description:
[Function]surface_copy_part(destination,x,y,source,xs,ys,ws,hs) 
Copies the indicated part of the source surface at position (x,y) in the destination surface. (Without any form of blending.)

tile_add.description:
[Function]tile_add(background,left,top,width,height,x,y,depth) 
Adds a new tile to the room with the indicated values (see above for their meaning). The function returns the id of the tile that can be used later on.

tile_delete.description:
[Function]tile_delete(id) 
Deletes the tile with the given id.

tile_exists.description:
[Function]tile_exists(id) 
Returns whether a tile with the given id exists.

tile_get_x.description:
[Function]tile_get_x(id) 
Returns the x-position of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_y.description:
[Function]tile_get_y(id) 
Returns the y-position of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_left.description:
[Function]tile_get_left(id) 
Returns the left value of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_top.description:
[Function]tile_get_top(id) 
Returns the top value of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_width.description:
[Function]tile_get_width(id) 
Returns the width of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_height.description:
[Function]tile_get_height(id) 
Returns the height of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_depth.description:
[Function]tile_get_depth(id) 
Returns the depth of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_visible.description:
[Function]tile_get_visible(id) 
Returns whether the tile with the given id is visible.

tile_get_xscale.description:
[Function]tile_get_xscale(id) 
Returns the xscale of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_yscale.description:
[Function]tile_get_yscale(id) 
Returns the yscale of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_background.description:
[Function]tile_get_background(id) 
Returns the background of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_blend.description:
[Function]tile_get_blend(id) 
Returns the blending color of the tile with the given id.

tile_get_alpha.description:
[Function]tile_get_alpha(id) 
Returns the alpha value of the tile with the given id.

tile_set_position.description:
[Function]tile_set_position(id,x,y) 
Sets the position of the tile with the given id.

tile_set_region.description:
[Function]tile_set_region(id,left,right,width,height) 
Sets the region of the tile with the given id in its background.

tile_set_background.description:
[Function]tile_set_background(id,background) 
Sets the background for the tile with the given id.

tile_set_visible.description:
[Function]tile_set_visible(id,visible) 
Sets whether the tile with the given id is visible.

tile_set_depth.description:
[Function]tile_set_depth(id,depth) 
Sets the depth of the tile with the given id.

tile_set_scale.description:
[Function]tile_set_scale(id,xscale,yscale) 
Sets the scaling of the tile with the given id.

tile_set_blend.description:
[Function]tile_set_blend(id,color) 
Sets the blending color of the tile with the given id.

tile_set_alpha.description:
[Function]tile_set_alpha(id,alpha) 
Sets the alpha value of the tile with the given id.

tile_layer_hide.description:
[Function]tile_layer_hide(depth) 
Hides all tiles at the indicated depth layer.

tile_layer_show.description:
[Function]tile_layer_show(depth) 
Shows all tiles at the indicated depth layer.

tile_layer_delete.description:
[Function]tile_layer_delete(depth) 
Deletes all tiles at the indicated depth layer.

tile_layer_shift.description:
[Function]tile_layer_shift(depth,x,y) 
Shifts all tiles at the indicated depth layer over the vector x,y. Can be used to create scrolling layers of tiles.

tile_layer_find.description:
[Function]tile_layer_find(depth,x,y) 
Returns the id of the tile with the given depth at position (x,y). When no tile exists at the position -1 is returned. When multiple tiles with the given depth exist at the position the first one is returned.

tile_layer_delete_at.description:
[Function]tile_layer_delete_at(depth,x,y) 
Deletes the tile with the given depth at position (x,y). When multiple tiles with the given depth exist at the position they are all deleted.

tile_layer_depth.description:
[Function]tile_layer_depth(depth,newdepth) 
Changes the depth of all tiles at the indicated depth to the new depth. With this function you can move whole tile layers to a new depth.

display_get_width.description:
[Function]display_get_width() 
Returns the width of the display in pixels.

display_get_height.description:
[Function]display_get_height() 
Returns the height of the display in pixels.

display_get_colordepth.description:
[Function]display_get_colordepth() 
Returns the color depth in bits.

display_get_frequency.description:
[Function]display_get_frequency() 
Returns the refresh frequency of the display.

display_set_size.description:
[Function]display_set_size(w,h) 
Sets the width and height of the display in pixels. Returns whether this was successful. (Realize that only certain combinations are allowed.)

display_set_colordepth.description:
[Function]display_set_colordepth(coldepth) 
Sets the color depth. In general only 16 and 32 are allowed values. Returns whether successful.

display_set_frequency.description:
[Function]display_set_frequency(frequency) 
Sets the refresh frequency for the display. Only few frequencies are allowed. Typically you could set this to 60 with a same room speed to get smooth 60 frames per second motion. Returns whether successful.

display_set_all.description:
[Function]display_set_all(w,h,frequency,coldepth) 
Sets all at once. Use -1 for values you do not want to change. Returns whether successful.

display_test_all.description:
[Function]display_test_all(w,h,frequency,coldepth) 
Tests whether the indicated settings are allowed. It does not change the settings. Use -1 for values you do not want to change. Returns whether the settings are allowed.

display_reset.description:
[Function]display_reset() 
Resets the display settings to the ones when the program was started, and also allow you to change the current level of Full Screen Anti-Aliasing being used. Available levels are 0,2,4 and 8. GameMaker start up with 0.

display_mouse_get_x.description:
[Function]display_mouse_get_x() 
Returns the x-coordinate of the mouse on the display.

display_mouse_get_y.description:
[Function]display_mouse_get_y() 
Returns the y-coordinate of the mouse on the display.

display_mouse_set.description:
[Function]display_mouse_set(${1:x},${2:y}) 
Sets the position of the mouse on the display to the indicated values.

window_set_visible.description:
[Function]window_set_visible(visible) 
Sets whether the game window is visible. Clearly you normally want the window to remain visible during the whole game. The program will not receive keyboard events when the window is invisible.

window_get_visible.description:
[Function]window_get_visible() 
Returns whether the game window is visible.

window_set_fullscreen.description:
[Function]window_set_fullscreen(full) 
Sets whether the window is shown in full screen mode.

window_get_fullscreen.description:
[Function]window_get_fullscreen() 
Returns whether the window is shown in full screen mode.

window_set_showborder.description:
[Function]window_set_showborder(show) 
Sets whether the border around the window is shown. (In full screen mode it is never shown.)

window_get_showborder.description:
[Function]window_get_showborder() 
Returns whether the border around the window is shown in windowed mode.

window_set_showicons.description:
[Function]window_set_showicons(show) 
Sets whether the border icons (iconize, maximize, close) are shown. (In full screen mode these are never shown.)

window_get_showicons.description:
[Function]window_get_showicons() 
Returns whether the border icons are shown in windowed mode.

window_set_stayontop.description:
[Function]window_set_stayontop(stay) 
Sets whether the window must always stay on top of other windows.

window_get_stayontop.description:
[Function]window_get_stayontop() 
Returns whether the window always stays on top of other windows.

window_set_sizeable.description:
[Function]window_set_sizeable(sizeable) 
Sets whether the window is sizeable by the player. (The player can only size it when the border is shown and the window is not in full screen mode.)

window_get_sizeable.description:
[Function]window_get_sizeable() 
Returns whether the window is sizeable by the player.

window_set_caption.description:
[Function]window_set_caption(caption) 
Sets the caption string for the window. Normally you specify this when defining the room and it can be changed using the variable room_caption. So this function is normally not useful, unless you draw the room yourself rather than letting GameMaker do it. The caption is only visible when the window has a border and when it is not in full screen mode.

window_set_cursor.description:
[Function]window_set_cursor(curs) 
Sets the mouse cursor used in the window. You can use the following constant: 
cr_default
cr_none
cr_arrow
cr_cross
cr_beam
cr_size_nesw
cr_size_ns
cr_size_nwse
cr_size_we
cr_uparrow
cr_hourglass
cr_drag
cr_nodrop
cr_hsplit
cr_vsplit
cr_multidrag
cr_sqlwait
cr_no
cr_appstart
cr_help
cr_handpoint
cr_size_all
In particular, to hide the mouse cursor, use cr_none as value.

window_get_cursor.description:
[Function]window_get_cursor() 
Returns the cursor used in the window.

window_set_color.description:
[Function]window_set_color(color) 
Sets the color of the part of the window that is not used for displaying the room.

window_set_region_scale.description:
[Function]window_set_region_scale(scale,adaptwindow) 
If the window is larger than the actual room normally the room is displayed in a region centered in the window. It is though possible to indicate that it must be scaled to fill the whole or part of the window. A value of 1 is no scaling. If you use a value of 0 the region will be scaled to fill the whole window. If you set it to a negative value it will be scaled to the maximal size inside the window while maintaining the aspect ratio (this is often what you want). adaptwindow indicates whether the window size must be adapted if the scaled room does not fit in. Adapting the window is only effective when the scale factor is positive.

window_get_region_scale.description:
[Function]window_get_region_scale() 
Returns the scale factor for the drawing region.

window_set_position.description:
[Function]window_set_position(x,y) 
Sets the position of the (client part of the) window to the indicated position.

window_set_size.description:
[Function]window_set_size(w,h) 
Sets the size of the (client part of the) window to the indicated size. Note that is the indicated size is too small to fit the drawing region it is kept large enough for the region to fit it.

window_set_rectangle.description:
[Function]window_set_rectangle(x,y,w,h) 
Sets the position and size of the window rectangle.

window_center.description:
[Function]window_center() 
Centers the window on the screen.

window_default.description:
[Function]window_default() 
Gives the window the default size and position (centered) on the screen.

window_get_x.description:
[Function]window_get_x() 
Returns the current x-coordinate of the window.

window_get_y.description:
[Function]window_get_y() 
Returns the current y-coordinate of the window.

window_get_width.description:
[Function]window_get_width() 
Returns the current width of the window.

window_get_height.description:
[Function]window_get_height() 
Returns the current height of the window.

window_mouse_get_x.description:
[Function]window_mouse_get_x() 
Returns the x-coordinate of the mouse in the window.

window_mouse_get_y.description:
[Function]window_mouse_get_y() 
Returns the y-coordinate of the mouse in the window.

window_mouse_set.description:
[Function]window_mouse_set(x,y) 
Sets the position of the mouse in the window to the indicated values.

window_set_region_size.description:
[Function]window_set_region_size(w,h,adaptwindow) 
Set the width and height of the drawing region in the window. adaptwindow indicates whether the window size must be adapted if the region does not fit in. The window size will always be adapted if you use fixed scaling. (See the function window_set_region_scale().)

window_get_region_width.description:
[Function]window_get_region_width() 
Returns the current width of the drawing region.

window_get_region_height.description:
[Function]window_get_region_height() 
Returns the current height of the drawing region.

window_view_mouse_get_x.description:
[Function]window_view_mouse_get_x(id) 
Returns the x-coordinate of the mouse with respect to the view with index id.

window_view_mouse_get_y.description:
[Function]window_view_mouse_get_y(id) 
Returns the y-coordinate of the mouse with respect to the view with index id.

window_view_mouse_set.description:
[Function]window_view_mouse_set(id,x,y) 
Sets the position of the mouse with respect to the view with index id.

window_views_mouse_get_x.description:
[Function]window_views_mouse_get_x() 
Returns the x-coordinate of the mouse with respect to the view it is in (same as mouse_x).

window_views_mouse_get_y.description:
[Function]window_views_mouse_get_y() 
Returns the y-coordinate of the mouse with respect to the view it is in (same as mouse_y).

window_views_mouse_set.description:
[Function]window_views_mouse_set() 
Sets the position of the mouse with respect to the first view that is visible.

screen_redraw.description:
[Function]screen_redraw() 
Redraws the room by calling all draw events.

screen_refresh.description:
[Function]screen_refresh() 
Refreshes the screen using the current room image (not performing drawing events).

set_automatic_draw.description:
[Function]display_get_width(value) 
Indicates whether to automatically redraw the room (true, default) or not (false).

set_synchronization.description:
[Function]set_synchronization(value) 
Indicates whether to synchronize the drawing with the refresh frequency of the monitor.

screen_wait_vsync.description:
[Function]screen_wait_vsync() 
Waits for the next vertical synchronization of the monitor.

visible.description:
[Variable]visible 
If visible is true (1) the image is drawn, otherwise it is not drawn. Invisible instances are still active and create collision events; only you don't see them. Setting the visibility to false is useful for e.g. controller objects (make them non-solid to avoid collision events) or hidden switches.

sprite_index.description:
[Variable]sprite_index 
This is the index of the current sprite for the instance. You can change it to give the instance a different sprite. As value you can use the names of the different sprites you defined. Changing the sprite does not change the index of the currently visible subimage.

sprite_width.description:
[Variable]sprite_width* 
Indicates the width of the sprite. This value cannot be changed but you might want to use it.

sprite_height.description:
[Variable]sprite_height* 
Indicates the height of the sprite. This value cannot be changed but you might want to use it.

sprite_xoffset.description:
[Variable]sprite_xoffset* 
Indicates the horizontal offset of the sprite as defined in the sprite properties. This value cannot be changed but you might want to use it.

sprite_yoffset.description:
[Variable]sprite_yoffset* 
Indicates the vertical offset of the sprite as defined in the sprite properties. This value cannot be changed but you might want to use it.

image_number.description:
[Variable]image_number* 
The number of subimages for the current sprite for the instance (cannot be changed).

image_index.description:
[Variable]image_index 
When the image has multiple subimages the program cycles through them. This variable indicates the currently drawn subimage (they are numbered starting from 0). You can change the current image by changing this variable. The program will continue cycling, starting at this new index. (The value can have a fractional part. In this case it is always rounded down to obtain the subimage that is drawn.)

image_speed.description:
[Variable]image_speed 
The speed with which we cycle through the subimages. A value of 1 indicates that each step we get the next image. Smaller values will switch subimages slower, drawing each subimage multiple times. Larger values will skip subimages to make the motion faster. Sometimes you want a particular subimage to be visible and don't want the program to cycle through all of them. This can be achieved by setting the speed to 0 and choosing the correct subimage.

depth.description:
[Variable]depth 
Normally images are drawn in the order in which the instances are created. You can change this by setting the image depth. The default value is 0, unless you set it to a different value in the object properties. The higher the value the further the instance is away. (You can also use negative values.) Instances with higher depth will lie behind instances with a lower depth. Setting the depth will guarantee that the instances are drawn in the order you want (e.g. the plane in front of the cloud). Background instances should have a high (positive) depth, and foreground instances should have a low (negative) depth.

image_xscale.description:
[Variable]image_xscale 
A scale factor to make larger or smaller images. A value of 1 indicates the normal size. You must separately set the horizontal xscale and vertical yscale. Changing the scale also changes the values for the image width and height and influences collision events as you might expect. Changing the scale can be used to get a 3-D effect. You can use a value of -1 to mirror the sprite horizontally.

image_yscale.description:
[Variable]image_yscale 
The vertical yscale. 1 is no scaling. You can use a value of -1 to flip the sprite vertically.

image_angle.description:
[Variable]image_angle 
The angle with which the sprite is rotated. You specify this in degrees, counterclockwise. A value of 0 indicates no rotation.

image_blend.description:
[Variable]image_blend 
Blending color used when drawing the sprite. A value of c_white is the default. When you specify a different value the image is blended with this color. This can be used to colorize the sprite on the fly.

bbox_left.description:
[Variable]bbox_left* 
Left side of the bounding box of the instance in the room, as defined by its image (taking scaling into account).

bbox_right.description:
[Variable]bbox_right* 
Right side of the bounding box of the instance in the room.

bbox_top.description:
[Variable]bbox_top* 
Top side of the bounding box of the instance in the room.

bbox_bottom.description:
[Variable]bbox_bottom* 
Bottom side of the bounding box of the instance in the room.

background_showcolor.description:
[Variable]background_showcolor 
Whether to clear the window in the background color.

background_visible.description:
[Variable]background_visible[0..7] 
Whether the particular background image is visible.

background_foreground.description:
[Variable]background_foreground[0..7] 
Whether the particular background image is visible.

background_index.description:
[Variable]background_index[0..7] 
Background image index for the background.

background_x.description:
[Variable]background_x[0..7] 
X position of the background image.

background_y.description:
[Variable]background_y[0..7] 
Y position of the background image.

background_xscale.description:
[Variable]background_xscale[0..7] 
Horizontal scaling factor for the background. (This must be positive; you cannot use a negative value to mirror the background.)

background_yscale.description:
[Variable]background_yscale[0..7] 
Vertical scaling factor for the background. (This must be positive; you cannot use a negative value to flip the background.)

background_hspeed.description:
[Variable]background_hspeed[0..7] 
Horizontal scrolling speed of the background (pixels per step).

background_vspeed.description:
[Variable]background_vspeed[0..7] 
Vertical scrolling speed of the background (pixels per step).

background_blend.description:
[Variable]background_blend[0..7] 
Blending color to use when drawing the background. A value of c_white is the default.

background_alpha.description:
[Variable]background_alpha[0..7] 
Transparency (alpha) value to use when drawing the background. A value of 1 is the normal setting; a value of 0 is completely transparent.

view_enabled.description:
[Variable]view_enabled 
Whether views are enabled or not.

view_current.description:
[Variable]view_current* 
The currently drawn view (0-7). Use this only in the drawing event. You can for example check this variable to draw certain things in only one view. Variable cannot be changed.

view_visible.description:
[Variable]view_visible[0..7] 
Whether the particular view is visible on the screen.

view_xview.description:
[Variable]view_xview[0..7] 
X position of the view in the room.

view_yview.description:
[Variable]view_yview[0..7] 
Y position of the view in the room.

view_wview.description:
[Variable]view_wview[0..7] 
Width of the view in the room.

view_hview.description:
[Variable]view_hview[0..7] 
Height of the view in the room.

view_xport.description:
[Variable]view_xport[0..7] 
X-position of the viewport in the drawing region.

view_yport.description:
[Variable]view_yport[0..7] 
Y-position of the viewport in the drawing region.

view_wport.description:
[Variable]view_wport[0..7] 
Width of the viewport in the drawing region.

view_hport.description:
[Variable]view_hport[0..7] 
Height of the viewport in the drawing region.

view_angle.description:
[Variable]view_angle[0..7] 
Rotation angle used for the view in the room (counter-clockwise in degrees).

view_hborder.description:
[Variable]view_hborder[0..7] 
Size of horizontal border around the visible object (in pixels).

view_vborder.description:
[Variable]view_vborder[0..7] 
Size of vertical border around visible object (in pixels).

view_hspeed.description:
[Variable]view_hspeed[0..7] 
Maximal horizontal speed of the view.

view_vspeed.description:
[Variable]view_vspeed[0..7] 
Maximal vertical speed of the view.

view_object.description:
[Variable]view_object[0..7] 
Object whose instance must remain visible in the view. If there are multiple instances of this object only the first one is followed. You can also assign an instance id to this variable. In that case the particular instance is followed.

pr_pointlist.description: [Constant]pr_pointlist The vertices are a set of points.

pr_linelist.description: [Constant]pr_linelist The vertices are a set of line segments. Each pair of vertices forms a line segment. So there must be an even set of vertices.

pr_linestrip.description:
[Constant]pr_linestrip 
The vertices form a polyline with the first connected to the second, the second to the third, etc. The last one is not connected to the first one. You have to specify an extra copy of the first vertex for this.

pr_trianglelist.description:
[Constant]pr_trianglelist 
The vertices are a set of triangles. Each triple of vertices forms a triangle. So the number of vertices must be a multiple of 3.

pr_trianglestrip.description:
[Constant]pr_trianglestrip 
The vertices again form triangles but this time it works slightly different. The first three form the first triangle. The last two of these vertices, together with the next vertex, form the second triangle, etc. So each new vertex specifies a new triangle, connected to the previous one.

pr_trianglefan.description:
[Constant]pr_trianglefan 
Similar to a triangle list but this time the first vertex is part of all the triangles. Again, each new vertex specifies a new triangle, connected to the previous vertex and the first vertex.

external_define.description:
[Function]external_define(dll,name,calltype,restype,argnumb,arg1type,arg2type, ...) 
Defines an external function. dll is the name of the dll file. name is the name of the functions. calltype is the calling convention used. For this use either dll_cdecl or dll_stdcall. restype is the type of the result. For this use either ty_real or ty_string. argnumb is the number of arguments (0-16). Next, for each argument you must specify its type. For this again use either ty_real or ty_string. When there are more than 4 arguments all of them must be of type ty_real.

external_call.description:
[Function]external_call(id,arg1,arg2, ...) 
Calls the external function with the given id, and the given arguments. You need to provide the correct number of arguments of the correct type (real or string). The function returns the result of the external function.

external_free.description:
[Function]external_free(dll) 
Frees the DLL with the given name. This is in particular necessary if the game should remove the DLL. As long as the DLL is not freed it cannot be removed. Best do this e.g. in an end of game event.

execute_string.description:
[Function]execute_string(str,arg0,arg1, ...) 
Execute the piece of code in the string str with the indicated arguments.

execute_file.description:
[Function]execute_file(fname) 
Execute the piece of code in the file.

window_handle.description:
[Function]window_handle() 
Returns the window handle for the main window.
